Comment: Once in a while I listen to the focus group podcast, and a recent one had Biden > Trump voters on, asking them what their thoughts were on Trump after roughly 100 days. One of the big takeaways is that the average person doesn‚Äôt know what to believe. There are still people who believe the truth lies somewhere in the middle of what CNN/MSNBC and Fox says. And that‚Äôs if they‚Äôre even paying attention. Some people believe politics is so corrupt that Trump is simply doing what all politicians do. They cite these vague accusations of things they heard Biden do and say ‚Äúwell,  Trumps getting payback for all the shady stuff done to his people‚Äù. The list goes on, but the point remains that we are still a while away before we reach critical mass on people being angry enough about what Trump is doing to do something about it.   People are concerned, don‚Äôt get me wrong. Most of the respondents were concerned about the economy because of course they know that will affect them. But there are still too many who believe everything that‚Äôs happening is somehow normal. And they believe it because they can‚Äôt process the reality that we‚Äôre sliding into authoritarianism, and they think democracy will weather the storm as it always has.   Suffice to say that I‚Äôve listened to a few of these podcasts and walk away with even less faith in the average person than I did before. It reinforces the belief that Americans can be trusted to do the right thing only after they‚Äôve exhausted all other options.
